*div1 type="summary"* *p*Felix Robertson to Austin, March 8, 1827. Asking assistance for Nashville company. Prospects of great emigration to Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Nashville */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="03-08-1827">8th March 1827*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Colo. Austin*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*Dear Sir, *person_mentioned*Majr. League*/person_mentioned* the *person_mentioned*bearer */person_mentioned*of this has been appointed by the *person_mentioned*Texas association*/person_mentioned* of this *location_mentioned*place */location_mentioned*their *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*to go to *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned* and apply to the convention now in session there in their behalf. To comply with the letter of the collonization law in the settling of their *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*presents so many and serious difficulties to the view of the *person_mentioned*Company*/person_mentioned*, that they have become very much disheartend, and will I believe cause them to entirely abandon the enterprise, unless they can obtain some modification of the *location_mentioned*grant */location_mentioned*more favorable to its settlement. In their opinion the *person_mentioned*government */person_mentioned*can make terms much more favorable to the *person_mentioned*company*/person_mentioned*, and in the end eventuate to the interest of the Government. This *person_mentioned*company */person_mentioned*wish particularly to have the power of selecting their *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned*, who are to be their *person_mentioned*neighbours*/person_mentioned*. This seems to be a "sine qua non" to any further attempt to make *location_mentioned*settlements */location_mentioned*in the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*. If they do settle in the *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*they wish their lives and property to be as safe as their prudence can make them, and they think this can only be effected by the power being vested in themselves to keep out of their *location_mentioned*settlement */location_mentioned*any persons they may have the least suspicion of being restless, discontented, revolutionizing and disorganizing persons—*person_mentioned*Majr League*/person_mentioned* will communicate freely with you touching the matter for which he goes on to the *location_mentioned*seat of government*/location_mentioned*, and so far as you may think them proper and obtainable, your cooperation with him to effect the wishes of this *person_mentioned*company */person_mentioned*will be gratefully acknowledged by them. It is my present opinion that should*person_mentioned* Majr. League*/person_mentioned* succeed in obtaining some of the vital changes desired, and your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*remain quiet through the *date_mentioned n="Summer - 1827">summer */date_mentioned*infinately a greater tide [of] emigration will set into it *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1827">next fall*/date_mentioned* than has ever yet been experienced. I think at present it would greatly benefit your *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned* for it to be generally understood, (and be lawful) that *person_mentioned*foreigners*/person_mentioned* could hold *location_mentioned*landed estates*/location_mentioned* in it. My present limits will not allow me to go into the reasons for this opinion, but I have no doubt of its correstness—present me in the most friendly terms to our friend *person_mentioned*Ingram*/person_mentioned*, accept assurances of my highest regard*/p*
______ *p**person_mentioned*Felix Robertson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
